intro: Lasiocladus mollis, commonly known as the desert holly, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its succulent, spiny leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant has a robust root system that allows it to thrive in harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water, while its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lasiocladus mollis plays an important role in stabilizing desert soils and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
